results.label: Amazon Web Services
results.description: Amazon Web Services (abbreviated AWS) is a collection of remote computing services that together make up a cloud computing platform, offered over the Internet by Amazon. com. The most central and well-known of these services are Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3.

results.label: Amazon Elastic Block Store
results.description: Amazon Elastic Block Storage (EBS) provides raw block devices, that can be attached to Amazon EC2 instances. These block devices can then be used like any raw block device. In a typical use case, this would include formatting the device with a filesystem and mounting said filesystem. In addition EBS supports a number of advanced storage features, including snapshotting and cloning. Currently EBS volumes can be up to 1TB in size.
